name: Gold Lake Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent a week at Gold Lake Lodge, staying in a one room cabin with bath. We had a wonderful stay and can't wait to return. This is a terrific, old-style lodge in the mountains - perfect for getting away from it all, esspecially if you want to hike.
reviews.title: Arrived as guests, left as friends - wonderful place

reviews.text: The lodge is made up of a dining room, recreation room, and a nice outside seating area for common spaces and then individual cabins for the guests. The cabins are set away from the common areas a little bit, so there is plenty of peace and quiet. It is set in a nice grove of tall pines, so plenty of shade. It isn't right on the lake, but there are multiple lakes within a relatively short hike from the lodge.
reviews.title: Sierra Gem

reviews.text: The lodge is 100 years old and retains its historical character. It is rustic and a little quirky, which is part of the charm. Our cabin was small, but comfortable and clean. It was perfect for our needs. We had a nice front deck area and chairs - we spent time each day relaxing and reading after a day of hiking.
reviews.title: A Real Historic Gem in the Sierras!!!!

reviews.text: The meals served at the lodge dining room are very good. Just about everything is made fresh on-site. The quality is good and they have a nice variety. Meals are family style, so we had plenty of opportunity to talk with other guests and made some new friends. People from other lodges and the local area come for dinner too, which is fun.
reviews.title: Helpful staff, delicious food, warm hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: John, the owner, and his staff are top-notch. John recommended hikes and gave good information about the local area. He really makes the guests feel valued and like part of the family. And his staff is great - good service at dinner, always friendly and gracious.
reviews.title: Great location, great staff, great food, comfortable cabins

description: A cabin resort that provides all your meals, set in the Lakes Basin of the Northern California Sierra Nevadas. Boats for fishing, lakes for swimming, trails for hiking. Even golfing nearby. If you're looking for a romantic getaway, or a weekend of relaxation this summer, come for a visit. Breakfast and dinner are served and lunch can be taken on the trail with you. Forget the city and start a country adventure.
